column1: Question,Correct Answer,Wrong Answer 1,Wrong Answer 2,Wrong Answer 3
What happens to an object when no references point to it?,Eligible for garbage collection,Immediately deleted,Throws NullPointerException,Remains in memory forever
Which statement about object creation is true?,new keyword allocates memory on heap,new keyword allocates memory on stack,Objects are stored on stack,Primitives are stored on heap
What is a nested class?,A class defined within another class,A class that extends another class,A class with multiple constructors,A class in a different package
Which type of nested class has access to instance members of outer class?,Inner class,Static nested class,Local class,Both A and C
When is an object created in Java?,When new keyword is executed,When class is declared,When variable is declared,When constructor is called without new

Which statement about garbage collection is correct?,System.gc() suggests but doesn't guarantee GC,System.gc() immediately runs GC,delete keyword removes objects,finalize() prevents garbage collection
Which nested class can be instantiated without outer class instance?,Static nested class,Inner class,Anonymous class,Local class
What is a local class?,A class defined inside a method,A class in the same package,A public class,A class with local variables only
Which statement about object lifecycle is true?,Objects go through creation-use-GC phases,Objects must be manually deleted,Stack stores all objects,Objects never get removed from memory
What does finalize() method do?,Called by GC before object destruction,Prevents garbage collection,Creates new object,Initializes object
Which is true about anonymous classes?,They have no name and are declared inline,They must have a name,They cannot extend classes,They are always static
Which nested class can access local variables of enclosing method?,Local class (if variables are final or effectively final),Static nested class,Inner class,All nested classes
What happens when constructor throws exception?,Object is not created,Object is partially created,Object is created normally,Compilation error
Which statement about object references is correct?,Multiple references can point to same object,One object can only have one reference,References are stored on heap,Objects are stored on stack
Which is true about inner class instantiation?,Requires instance of outer class,Does not require outer class instance,Can only be instantiated in static context,Cannot be instantiated
What happens when object goes out of scope?,Reference is removed but object may remain in memory,Object is immediately deleted,Compilation error,NullPointerException
Which nested class type can be declared in an interface?,Static nested class (implicitly static),Inner class,Local class,Anonymous class with instance members
What happens with WeakReference objects?,Can be garbage collected even if referenced,Never garbage collected,Immediately garbage collected,Prevents garbage collection

Which statement about object creation is correct?,Constructor is called after memory allocation,Memory is allocated after constructor runs,new keyword only calls constructor,Objects can be created without new
Which is true about static nested classes?,Cannot access non-static members of outer class,Can access all members of outer class,Require outer class instance,Are instance members of outer class
What happens when creating object of abstract class?,Compilation error,Creates object normally,Creates null reference,Runtime error
Which statement about object equality is true?,== compares references,== compares object content,equals() always compares references,new objects with same values have == true
What happens with lambda expressions?,Create instances of functional interfaces,Create new classes,Cannot be instantiated,Are static nested classes

Which is true about object initialization?,Instance variables initialized before constructor body,Constructor runs before instance initialization,Static variables initialized last,Final variables cannot be initialized in constructor
